author: schone_wizard
content: can someone explain in laymen terms to me, how is the miner tip, not creating the same problems we have today with first price auction?

author: schone_wizard
content: how would that not revert to becoming that and thus creating much volatility in how much people are paying for their transactions

author: arlig
content: The fact that block are targeted at being on average 50% full means that in almost all situations (except for when there is rapidly increasing demand) your transaktion is guaranteed to be included as long as you pay the basefee+minimum miner tip (1 gwei). This means that there is no incentive to bid up the tip in order to be included

author: arlig
content: The exception to this is as said situations of rapidly increasing demand or for people who care a lot about not only if they are included in a block, but also where in the block they are included

author: arlig
content: This is to the best of my knowledge, if i got something wrong feel free to correct

author: arlig

author: trent_vanepps
content: There is no guarantee that 1559 will reduce average gas prices, this is a common misconception. The intent is to reduce massive variability in inter-block gas prices, thereby smoothing congestion across blocks

author: trent_vanepps
content: One possible side effect is that gas prices may potentially be lower due to better fee estimation for users
